Deprecated API

  • Deprecated Methods

    Method and Description
    com.engiweb.profilemanager.common.ruleengine.action.UserAction.addDelegated(DAO, UserBean, UserBean, <any>, String, String)
    see #addDelegated(DAO, UserBean, UserBean, BeanList, Date, Date)
    com.engiweb.profilemanager.common.ruleengine.action.reorganize._UserAction.addEntitlements(DAO, boolean, boolean, <any>, <any>, OrgUnitBean, <any>, UserBean)
    Replaced by #addEntitlements(DAO, boolean, boolean, OrgUnitBean, BeanList, UserBean)

    The method adds a given list of entitlements to the user given that must belong to an organization unit. If the user doesn't belong to any organization unit, it can be passed the organization unit to associate to the user. However if the user already belongs to an organization unit, it is important that the organization unit passed corresponds to the organization unit of the user. The defaultEntitlements flag specifies whether the method must also to associate default entitlements of the organization unit or not. The checkIncomp flag specifies whether the method must to check the incompatibility of the entitlements, with those the user already has, or not. In case of incompatibility, it throws an exception. It is also possible to associate a list of remediation to correct an unmanaged Sod situation and a list of valorized entitlement rights to associate to the user.

    com.engiweb.profilemanager.common.ruleengine.action.reorganize.accesscertifier.TemplateAction.addOU(DAO, int, boolean, OrgUnitBean, TemplateBean)
    Replaced by {TemplateAction.addOU(DAO, int, int, OrgUnitBean, TemplateBean) The method adds the organization unit given to the template given. The listTypeBW int parameter is used to specify the type of the list where to add the organization unit. Allowed values are: 0-add the organization unit to the Black List, 1-add the organization unit to the White List.
